details: KPB Hinduja College, Girgoan conducted Deloitte Placement Drive and 2 students got selected.

Placement cell has organised a session on career guidance for TYBCom students titled Carving the path to success on 30th Nov 2018. Career consultant Ms. Bhuvaneswari Raman was the speaker. Speaker discussed various career options that students can pursue after graduation.
An awareness session on PCOS was organised for girl students by WDC on 29th Nov 2018. Speaker was `Dr. Jyothi Kulkarni, a gynecologist.

The project involved educating underprivileged women and children about menstrual cycle and hygiene related to it. It also focused on breaking the myths related to menstruation. The speaker was Miss. Priya Tiwari. She was there from an NGO 'Safe City'.

Yellow Fellow was an event to break a world record wearing yellow socks puppets showing rights for children. Event was organized by CRY (child rights and you). It was an attempt to break a world record and to note into genius books of world record.

? Some RID 3141 club decided to do clothes Donation on specific same day at different possible area. ? So, We planned clothes donation drive near the Tata memorial hospital where people where living on footpath

? On the occasion of World diabetes day, lions club international district 323, organized a rally from five gardens, matunga to khalsa college ground, with a huge crowd of 1500 and more people. ? The reporting time for the rally was 7:30am at 5 gardens.

'Reliving The Era' was an official ceremony for inducting the core team and board of directors of 2018-2019. The occasion was embraced by some special dignitaries namely., Dr. Nina Roy Choudhury (SIES College Principal), Rotary President Rtn. K.B.R Swamy and DRR Elect 18-19 Rtr. Kushal Buwa just to name a few.
Educate girls on self defence

Since 1988, the 11th of October every years is celebrated as World Coming Out Day. The initial idea to celebrate this day was to lay emphasis on the basic form of activism, i.e. coming out to friends, family and colleagues and living kife as an openly gay or lesbian person. With the Supreme Court, legalizing homosexuality in India this year, it was important to create awareness regarding the pressure one goes through while coming out. In order to achieve this a silent skit was performed in the quadrangle of the college, involving 6 members as performers.

The event 'Festive Inshorts' was organized to let the club members, writers and non- writers take some time off and think about what festivals mean to them. Since the month of October is essential with tons of festivals, It comes along with the joy and the excitement of celebrating these festivities in a combination of traditional and modern ways.

The project was conducted in a way by teaching the students various steps of garba. We had 3 garba teachers to come and teach various garba steps to the students. There was a lot of excitement for the upcoming navratri festival, thus the enthusiasm to learn garba was a lot among everyone.
Hands-on Training on J-Gate online databases for Third year and Postgraduate Students

As Indian railways took an initiative of cleaning railway stations across India on account of 150th birthday of Mahatma Gandhi - Father of nation. To help them out and volunteer our time for Swachhta Abhiyaan, we planned to clean and create cleanliness awareness at Dadar station. We spoke to Dadar Central Railway Station director Savan sir to organize the cleanliness drive, and they were glad that we had taken the initiative to do so and gave a positive response for the project.
Workshop for non-teaching staff on Health Management - Ergonomic Interactive Session.

As part of its extra-curricular activities, SIES-C&E organised its annual career guidance festival, 'DISHA - The Edu-tainment Fiesta.' Disha aimed to enrich the youth by educating them about myriad career opportunities through seminars, workshops, and competitions. The event was held on 27-28th September 2018, with inauguration and internship fair on 26th September.
An intra collegiate competition titled Antarman was organised by the counselling committee. Students enthusiastically participated in various events.
This year, we celebrated differently by focusing on peace within our country. We sought people’s opinions on peace in India, promoting unity among diverse faiths and religions.
WDC in collaboration with NGO Majlis organised an intra collegiate competition on the theme My Body - My Choice. Students from various courses participated in different events.
Workshop for non-teaching staff on Essentials of Dealing with Situations.
Donation drive.
Bappagraphy was an initiative where participants captured Ganpati idols creatively, showcasing their photography skills and perspectives.
Legends of Champions League was a quiz conducted via WhatsApp, testing participants’ knowledge about the UEFA Champions League.
Mentor: Epitome for Life was an online initiative encouraging people to share stories about their mentors and their positive influence.
To know members better.
Celebration of Women's Equality Day with team-based speech activities where members spoke on various topics.
Workshop for teachers on How to Develop E-Content.
On the occasion of Rakshabandhan, celebrated with children of Bal Anand World Children Welfare Trust India.
Volunteers collected unused clothes and made cloth bags out of them.
Volunteers conducted class-to-class publicity about stem cell donation and gathered around 67 donors in collaboration with Marrow Donor India.
A talk on gender sensitization was organised for FY B.Com students by Ms. Kirthy C. Nair, Research Scholar, TISS.
An orientation program for teachers on various psychological issues conducted by the Students Counselling Committee.

Our volunteers went to Mhada Colony and gave Polio Immunization Vaccine to children below 5 years of age and also did publicity in that area so that most children could take benefit from the vaccine, which was in collaboration with Sion Transit Camp Hospital.
A session on anger management was organised by the counselling committee on 31st July 2018 for students.

Green Hands, the Global Tree Plantation Project, is an initiative carried out by Searic, a Multi District Information Organization. It is a movement towards environmental protection and sustainability with the motive of planting saplings rightly known as 'The Trees of Tomorrow' in our vicinity.

The project Kargil Vijay Divas was undertaken to celebrate the victory of India in the Kargil War and commemorate the sacrifices of our martyrs. An officer from the National Security Guard or Black Cat Commandos was invited as the guest of honor, who had an interactive session with members and participants. A documentary on the Kargil War was also played.
Wonder In Pages (WOIP) is a project to encourage book exchange. To change the perception of judging books by their covers, Wonder in Pages was initiated to promote sharing and reading.
A Hepatitis B vaccination drive was conducted in collaboration with SEHAT United Way Mumbai. It was the second vaccination drive for those who missed out earlier.
Beach Clean-Up at Worli Fort. Two volunteers participated in a 24-hour clean-up which was included in the Limca Book of World Records for the longest continuous beach clean-up.
Handled COURSES, COMMITTEES, and AQR Report work including data segregation.
Workshop for teachers on SPSS & AMOS.
Tree plantation at Sion Fort with Archaeological Survey of India. Total 38 plants were planted in the vicinity of the fort.
Sion Fort.
Bandodkar College of Science, Thane conducted an LTI Placement Drive where 3 students got selected.
Viva College, Virar conducted a Capgemini Placement Drive where 14 students got selected.

An officer from the National Security Guard or Black Cat Commandos was invited as the guest of honor, who had an interactive session with the members and participants. A documentary on the Kargil War was also played.
State level seminar on 'Intellectual Property Rights' for students.

As part of its extra-curricular activities, SIES-C&E organised its annual career guidance festival, 'DISHA - The Edu-tainment Fiesta.' Disha 2017 was scheduled for 18th–20th September 2017, but due to heavy rainfall, events on the 20th were rescheduled to 23rd September. The event included seminars, workshops, and competitions to promote awareness of new-age careers.
English Language Development session on English Language Development.
128 students of the college were selected for internships during the year: 35 through the Internship Cell, 29 via Internshala tie-up, and 64 through self-arranged opportunities.
